node.content: {"_uid":"ddc0b441-3741-4646-b9e6-4c4670afff20","body":[{"_uid":"c9d58207-57a0-47b2-ae32-d29583dfa11c","title":"THANK YOU FOR  YOUR SUPPORT.","content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Thanks for choosing to support ANDYSMANCLUB as part of your fundraiser.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"type":"hard_break","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"text":"We’ll send a fundraising pack to you via email, so keep an eye out.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]},"component":"simple-centered-branded","button_text":"BACK TO HOMEPAGE","button_target":{"id":"","url":"","linktype":"story","fieldtype":"multilink","cached_url":""},"background_color":"bg-white","black_background":false}],"meta":{"_uid":"66e90b72-aef7-46e6-95a3-eb4485a43a37","title":"","plugin":"seo_metatags","og_image":"","og_title":"","description":"","twitter_image":"","twitter_title":"","og_description":"","twitter_description":""},"component":"page"}

node.name: Contact Us
Lucas Whitehead
node.content: {"_uid":"a3552a3c-c56e-4830-8f08-6395913d0099","image":{"id":4637213,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/500x700/4f7894f3c0/team-images-b-w-lucas.jpg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"Head of Marketing & Partnerships","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi, I’m Lucas – Head of Marketing & Partnerships at AMC! Unlike other members of the team, I came into the role without having attended an AMC session although Mental Health and Suicide have always been a massive part of my life with close friends and family members blighted by both. It is of vital importance that we continue to promote talking and openness around mental health. My first AMC session came on my first day in the role back in January 2021 on a wintry night in Hartlepool and it is a night that will stick with me for life due to the profound effect it had on me. Outside of AMC, I am a keen Football and Rugby League fan, following Leeds United and Dewsbury Rams. I also currently manage Hade Edge FC.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]}}

node.name: Michael Chapplow
node.content: {"_uid":"cd917b0f-b6e1-4cff-ab27-7fa2f7e4e814","image":{"id":10241317,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/850x1396/2944fee44c/b16f713e-d63c-466a-a2e2-75b6f0e5213a.png","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"PROJECT DEVELOPMENT CHAMPION","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi I'm Michael, I have suffered from social anxiety and depression since childhood. With no diagnosis, this had a negative impact on adult life.  Before AMC, most of my social life was spent in my bedroom as I had no confidence to partake in social activities such as attending football matches, going to the pub and going to friends' parties. This changed when I was 31 and discovered AMC. I started attending the groups in 2019 and slowly started to gain confidence and overcome anxiety. This means I now have an active social life. I'm a season card holder at Sunderland AFC, I go out for meals with friends and even go sea swimming with friends I met at AMC.  I firmly believe the best thing I have learned is #ITSOKAYTOTALK as this has given me opportunities in life I never previously had. I believe talking is the most important thing you can do.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"hard_break"}]}]}}

node.name: Darren Edwards
node.content: {"_uid":"cd917b0f-b6e1-4cff-ab27-7fa2f7e4e814","image":{"id":10241079,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/768x1024/358cd8030b/aae8992b-ab92-464b-af62-275ede0fc6e9.jpg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"PROJECT DEVELOPMENT CHAMPION","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi, I’m Darren, in 2016 I lost my first wife Leanne to suicide, so began my journey with mental health, a chance meeting with a couple of guys from Andysmanclub in 2021 started my journey knowing that #itsokaytotalk. From stepping through the door for the first time, to be being asked to became a facilitator, everything felt right. Then to becoming part of the team, getting that next man through the door and being part of their journey is huge, everything happens for a reason.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]}}

node.name: Jacob Sharratt
node.content: {"_uid":"cd917b0f-b6e1-4cff-ab27-7fa2f7e4e814","image":{"id":13164031,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/1024x1260/03eef90bd0/jake_web.png","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"PROJECT DEVELOPMENT CHAMPION","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi, I’m Jake. I first started attending AMC in June 2021 on the first night of Pontefract group opening (group number 50). I was struggling with depression and anxiety for a long time and never to spoke to anyone about it, until I started attending AMC. when I first started attending, I was a quiet and shy person, after a couple of months I was a different man and the guys couldn’t get me to stop talking, then I got asked to be a facilitator. A couple of months later I went on to open a group in another location. I am now honoured to be a Project Development Champion for AMC. My main goal in my job role is to make sure that as many men as possible know that it is okay to talk and to not bottle up their feelings.","type":"text"},{"text":"  ","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"hard_break"}]}]}}

node.name: Alex McClintock
node.content: {"_uid":"7304166a-665e-40a4-96b4-42eee672516e","image":{"id":4637147,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/500x700/2bae5e4867/team-images-b-w-alex.jpg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"SENIOR PROJECT DEVELOPMENT CHAMPION","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi I am Alex McClintock, after experiencing my own mental health struggles and an attempt on my life I discovered ANDYSMANCLUB. Everything about ANDYSMANCLUB resonated with me and it ignited a passion within me to help make a difference particularly in men’s mental health. The power of talking has become a huge part of my life and I was honoured and humbled to be asked by Elaine and Luke to join the team, overseeing Scotland. I will continue to do what I can to challenge the stigmas in our society to help reach that one man and to help promote ANDYSMANCLUB every day with passion and commitment.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]}}

node.name: Kenny Armour
node.content: {"_uid":"7304166a-665e-40a4-96b4-42eee672516e","image":{"id":5877998,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/340x475/ba30e3f6e2/kenny_web_b_w.png","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"PROJECT DEVELOPMENT CHAMPION","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi! I am Kenny Armour, having suffered anxiety and depression for the past 7 years I hit rock bottom with life and self-employment getting the better of me. Luckily for me I had heard of the good work ANDYSMANCLUB had been doing and at the time I was looking for answers, AMC was opening in my local town. Using the club for what it is and then naturally falling into a facilitator role ignited a real passion within me to help other men open up and use the power of talking. Something I had never done due to working in the Oil & Gas industry, where I always thought that you keep your problems to yourself and you were the only one with problems. AMC has allowed me to understand that I am not alone and that #ITSOKAYTOTALK.","type":"text"}]}]}}

node.name: Mark Inglis
node.content: {"_uid":"7304166a-665e-40a4-96b4-42eee672516e","image":{"id":5877609,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/340x475/c188b21a9f/mark_web_b_w.png","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"PROJECT DEVELOPMENT CHAMPION","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi I am Mark Inglis, one of the PDCs for Scotland. I was signposted to ANDYSMANCLUB by a close friend after failed attempts on my life and something just clicked in me after my first meeting. AMC has helped me deal with my PTSD and the childhood trauma to the point now where I feel I can help others to walk through that door as I did and if I can help #ThatOneMan, then that is what it's all about. ANDYSMANCLUB has changed my life and hopefully I can do the same for others to break the stigma around men's mental health.","type":"text"}]}]}}

node.name: Oliver Vikse
node.content: {"_uid":"19c1f13f-257a-4bf2-863d-1a1c0a59a7a2","image":{"id":4637126,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/500x700/1752cf98ec/team-images-b-w-oliver.jpg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"Head of Innovation & Technology","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"HI, I’m Oli, in 2016 I attended the first ever ANDYSMANCLUB meeting and was the third person to speak. My life has gone from strength to strength ever since. The changes I have seen in myself, I have seen in others that have come to the club and I want every man who needs this to be able to experience it. I have a vision of making our services available to every man, in every town and city across the UK. Today, I am Head of Training, Development & Technology for ANDYSMANCLUB, making sure we have the right tools in place to deliver the best service possible. I like to spend my downtime outdoors, in the mountains of the Lake District or North Wales.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]}}

node.name: Neil Waine
node.content: {"_uid":"60c55494-2570-4644-bad4-56148c1cc741","image":{"id":4637113,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/500x700/09d578145b/team-images-b-w-neil.jpg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"PROJECT DEVELOPMENT & PARTNERSHIPS MANAGER","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi, I’m Neil Waine, one of the Project Development Champion team at ANDYSMANCLUB! Having taken the step and first walked through the door as a group user, the journey I have been on since has been amazing. I first started as a facilitator at Huddersfield in a position I held for just over 2 years until early 2021, when Luke and Elaine asked me to join the staff team! I now oversee our Project Development Team and Partnership Strategy - ensuring that we're spreading the word about ANDYSMANCLUB to businesses, charities, sports teams and anyone willing to listen! I am also a keen Huddersfield Town supporter, having appeared on the “And He Takes That Chance” podcast for a couple of years.","type":"text"}]}]}}

node.name: Dan Rowe
node.content: {"_uid":"7304166a-665e-40a4-96b4-42eee672516e","image":{"id":13129068,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/500x700/d5b5aaeac2/dan_web.png","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"SENIOR PROJECT DEVELOPMENT CHAMPION","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi, I'm Dan! I first attended AMC in Oldham back in January 2018 only two days after attempting to take my own life. At the time, I was struggling with Post-Natal Depression after the birth of my son and AMC presented a place where I could go open up about this without fear of judgement. Fast forward to the present day and I'm in a much better position, AMC helped me realise that I was not alone, realise that there were and still are guys out there going through what I was going through, and realise that it is okay to talk about how I feel and be vulnerable. I'm now committed to spreading that message as far and wide as I can.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]}}

node.name: Sean Gill
node.content: {"_uid":"7304166a-665e-40a4-96b4-42eee672516e","image":{"id":6697407,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/1536x2048/885f3c3077/sean_web_b_w.png","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"SENIOR PROJECT DEVELOPMENT CHAMPION","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi Im Sean, Senior Project Development Champion for ANDYSMANCLUB, Wow that title blows my mind each time because i was #THATONEMAN, 5 years ago i was in a really bad place. Attempted and continued to think about taking my own life. I was pointed towards ANDYSMANCLUB and thought id give a go, what did i have to lose? The answer was nothing but I had everything to gain. AMC has given me purpose and aspirations, helped me rebuild relationships and become a better person.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]}}

node.name: Luke Tetlow-Cross
node.content: {"_uid":"7304166a-665e-40a4-96b4-42eee672516e","image":{"id":13128611,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/3024x4032/02a574d5f0/image_20230908_132047_154.jpeg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"PROJECT DEVELOPMENT CHAMPION","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi, I’m Luke! I have dealt with anxiety and stress for the majority of my adult life, mainly due to my work life. The majority of the time, I would turn to my Dad who would always want a catch up to discuss the latest film or tv show and we would discuss what was going on with me. My dad was very supportive but would usually give me bad advice and then end it with a Dad joke. In November 2020, my dad went to the hospital with a chest infection and on shortly after, he passed away from Covid. It took 3 months to get the nerve to walk into my first AMC meeting which was in March 2021 in Rochdale. Since then, I have been open about sharing my story, and I facilitated for 2 years until starting my role in the north west. I am a fan of classic rock, Liverpool FC and I like spending time with my wife and kids.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"hard_break"}]}]}}

node.name: Tanya French
node.content: {"_uid":"704f0e54-de5d-43f0-a786-600813e56529","image":{"id":4637095,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/500x700/3ae7e97065/team-images-b-w-tanya.jpg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"HEAD OF EVENTS","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi my name is Tanya and I’m Head of Events at ANDYSMANCLUB, supporting the Marketing, Partnerships and Events team! Being from Halifax, I first heard about AMC just as it started back in 2016 and I’m delighted to be part of the team. I love helping others and making people smile and working for AMC gives me a chance to make a difference. Before I joined the AMC team I studied for a Business Degree and in my spare time there’s nothing I like more than going on a walk with my husband, two daughters and dog or going out for food – especially Italian or Mexican food!","type":"text"}]}]}}

node.name: Joanne Smith
node.content: {"_uid":"91a2d689-142e-480a-a242-9e039f0ee2f0","image":{"id":4637077,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/500x700/7211ad55d5/team-images-b-w-joanne.jpg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"HEAD OF ADMIN","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi, I’m Joanne Smith, I work in the office as the Head of our Admin Team, I’ve followed ANDYSMANCLUB right from the start, so it’s a privilege and honour to now be part of the team, I joined in January 2020. I’ve spent most of my life in retail, with 2018-2019 seeing me run my own Post Office. I gave this up in Autumn 2019 and set out to start a new life in Spain but was back a week later. I truly believe everything happens for a reason, what better reason than to help others. I have been welcomed by everyone, from the trustees, the office team, right through to the lads all over the country that make sure those doors are opened every week. Part of one big family!","type":"text"}]}]}}

node.name: Sabrina Mullins
node.content: {"_uid":"0f5fd958-e868-4ee4-8624-c96ae84a9615","image":{"id":4709870,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/500x700/6d01ff3cc1/team-images-b-w-sabrinam.jpg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"GENERAL MANAGER","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hello, my name is Sabrina Mullins and I am the General Manager at ANDYSMANCLUB. I have loved every minute of working for ANDYSMANCLUB since 2017. I originally started working here as a volunteer in the early days and have been here ever since.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"I have watched ANDYSMANCLUB grow and become something special and I am proud to have been here every step of the way. My work isn’t just work, there is a saying “if you find a job you love you will never work a day in your life” and this is it for me.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]}}

node.name: Karen Moran
node.content: {"_uid":"91a2d689-142e-480a-a242-9e039f0ee2f0","image":{"id":13130449,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/1536x2048/c6c542cbfb/image0-1-1.jpeg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"ADMINISTRATION ASSISTANT","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi, I’m Karen and I joined the admin team in January 2023.  I’ve been an avid supporter of AMC since I first found out about it in 2016, attending events and raising funds through various walking challenges including the Yorkshire Three Peaks.  I have previously worked as an IT Manager of a predominately male workforce for a number of years, and have seen firsthand the need for a vessel for men to offload.  I am honoured to be part of the team and I love, that as part of my job, I am able to make a difference to so many people’s lives.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]}}

node.name: Tom Nolan
node.content: {"_uid":"704f0e54-de5d-43f0-a786-600813e56529","image":{"id":6697531,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/1536x2048/3bbbe6f8b7/garry_web_b_w.png","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"position":"Organisational Support","component":"team_member","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hi I'm Tom! I first started attending AMC back in June 2018 after a number of triggering events and trauma all coming to a head. Walking into that room for the first time a weight lifted off my shoulders and I knew this had to be shared with as many people as possible. I then started to run a group in Batley, near my home town of Dewsbury, and eventually, in December 2022 I joined the staff team full time - assisting the admin team with the day-to-day running of the charity. Outside of AMC, I am a Dewsbury Rams fan and a father of 3 and a step-dad to 2. Without ANDYSMANCLUB, I wouldn't be here today!","type":"text"}]}]}}

node.name: Who We Are
node.content: {"_uid":"dbfed930-69e3-4532-9446-13264e8737b1","body":[{"_uid":"f1451d83-675c-48ae-a3da-9d328a9e9c07","title":"WE’RE HERE FOR YOU.","component":"hero","hero_image":{"id":4709426,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/1350x1275/881fb9d159/who-we-are-2-900x850.jpg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"button_text":"","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"At ANDYSMANCLUB, we want to eliminate the stigma surrounding mental health and create a judgment-free, confidential space where men can be open about the storms in their lives. We aim to achieve this through weekly, free-to-attend peer-to-peer support groups for men aged over 18. Watch the video below to find out why.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]},"button_target":{"id":"","url":"","linktype":"story","fieldtype":"multilink","cached_url":""},"background_color":"bg-black"},{"_uid":"8f61fecc-6d57-47f4-b35a-670fe1f45c8f","label":"","title":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"#ThatOneMan","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"italic"},{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]},"content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"#ThatOneMan is our promise to you, our volunteers, our attendees and our supporters, that no matter how quickly we grow, how many awards we win, how many partnerships we strike up or how many clubs we open, we will always remain true to our original goal. To be able to provide support to #ThatOneMan in his time of need, and help him see that his tomorrow can be better than his today.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]},"component":"two-column-text","button_text":"","button_target":{"id":"","url":"","linktype":"story","fieldtype":"multilink","cached_url":""},"background_color":"bg-black","white_background":false},{"_uid":"c2b988f2-22a3-4ce3-9bf7-35b5c8d33c0f","title":"ANDY’S STORY - LAD BIBLE","component":"youtube_video","youtube_id":"EcyedyEXJCg?si=d6FxiCWHTVO-MyrV","background_color":"bg-black"},{"_uid":"a73fe6f3-333c-4c7d-805e-45edcabfe53a","image":{"id":4707192,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/555x826/5bc137595a/our-story-370x550.jpg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"label":"OUR STORY","title":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"WE’RE A BUNCH OF BLOKES HAVING A CHAT OVER A BREW","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"& BISCUIT.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]},"content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"In mid-2016, nine men met in a small room in the stereotypical Yorkshire town of Halifax with a simple aim of talking through their issues and helping each other deal with their mental health. All in attendance were agreed there was a magic in that room that had to be shared. This was the start of a movement that has grown faster than anyone first involved could have ever imagined. Fast forward 7 years and ANDYSMANCLUB now has groups at over 150 locations across three countries of the UK. ","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"type":"hard_break","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"type":"hard_break","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"text":"ANDYSMANCLUB takes its name from Andrew Roberts, a man who sadly took his own life aged 23 in early 2016. Andy’s family had no inkling that he was suffering or struggling to the extent that he would do this, and as a result looked deeper into male suicide and men’s mental health. They soon discovered that male suicide is the biggest killer of men under 50, with male mental health surrounded by well-ingrained cultural stigma in the UK. ","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"type":"hard_break","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"type":"hard_break","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"text":"Elaine Roberts and Luke Ambler are Andy’s Mum and Brother-in-Law, together they came up with the idea of ANDYSMANCLUB, a group where men aged 18 and above can speak openly about their mental health in a judgment-free, non-clinical environment. Groups now operate nationwide and are completely volunteer-led, with the vast majority of group facilitators having first interacted with ANDYSMANCLUB when they came through the door as a service user.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"type":"hard_break","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"type":"hard_break","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"text":"With a service used on a weekly basis by over 3000 men, and an army of 900+ facilitators, the movement is always continuing to grow on a week-by-week basis.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]},"component":"two-column-text-image","button_text":"","button_target":{"id":"","url":"","linktype":"story","fieldtype":"multilink","cached_url":""},"background_color":"bg-white","black_background":false},{"_uid":"75f52f73-5627-4bf0-94ac-02b4046374a5","items":["4bb2a7ea-f9e2-4439-80b7-1b729ba3589f","64f30a81-642a-4e4d-b757-ddd6462f4cd3","6bd1e6d7-76f2-4393-864c-fafb45539175","d4913e0d-737d-43fd-8c15-dc2a2a9b5ed1","a22ce652-893b-43bb-a2a2-441deef31236","b8a5c024-4713-42b9-ba62-d5a5ab1b02c4","3b376000-b121-4627-bdc0-9f0f97daf1fc","409a1ea4-bc49-43f0-a7a9-c9864f76b8cd"],"label":"REAL PEOPLE, REAL STORIES","component":"testimonials","button_text":"See another story","background_color":"bg-white","black_background":false,"button_functionality":true},{"_uid":"563520f6-c780-4c32-b087-9e8166b620de","title":"OUR PEOPLE MAKE ALL THE DIFFERENCE.","content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"From our trustees, to the staff to our facilitators who swing open the doors every single Monday night to give guys a safe place to talk. To the army of volunteers who help raise awareness, backing and supporting us, commenting and liking our content. Our people are all so special and without them, we are nothing.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]},"component":"simple-centered-branded","button_text":"","button_target":{"id":"","url":"","linktype":"story","fieldtype":"multilink","cached_url":""},"background_color":"bg-black","black_background":true},{"_uid":"bba0cf2e-a202-4005-875d-feb9cbd9e276","label":"ANDYSMANCLUB","title":"OUR TRUSTEES","component":"team","grab_trustees":true,"background_color":"bg-black"},{"_uid":"473337aa-ef8d-4170-a2d1-c9dcf92bf95b","label":"ANDYSMANCLUB","title":"OUR TEAM","component":"team","grab_trustees":false,"background_color":"bg-black"},{"_uid":"8b7d809c-53f5-4aee-acfd-4e23a3a86de6","image":{"id":4634383,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/1000x750/8600fe2981/facilitator-image.jpg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"label":"ANDYSMANCLUB","title":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"OUR FACILITATORS. ","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"type":"hard_break","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"text":"OUR HEROES.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]},"content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Our facilitators are heroes in our eyes. We would love to be able to individually write about them all, due to having over 500 heroes, that would be very difficult. ","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"type":"hard_break","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"type":"hard_break","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"text":"What makes our facilitators heroes? It’s got to be the single fact the each and every one of them know how tough it is take that step through the door. Taking the step through the door for them allowed them to improve their own situation and get through their storm with the help of the other guys at the group. They decided they then wanted to help other guys through their storms. They selflessly turn up every Monday to open those doors for 7pm.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]},"component":"simple-center-branded-with-image","button_text":"","button_target":{"id":"","url":"","linktype":"story","fieldtype":"multilink","cached_url":""},"background_color":"bg-white"},{"_uid":"b6f43a7a-e49e-42b5-8d8e-5acd1729faab","title":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"ALL OUR GROUPS MEET EVERY MONDAY AT 7PM ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"(EXCEPT BANK HOLIDAYS).","type":"text"}]}]},"content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"We run talking groups for men who have either been through a storm, are currently going through a storm, have a storm brewing in life or just want to meet a good group of people with the aim of improving one another. No referral, no registration and no charge. Even the brew and biscuits are free!","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]},"component":"simple-centered-branded","button_text":"FIND YOUR NEAREST GROUP","button_target":{"id":"","url":"find-your-nearest-group","linktype":"url","fieldtype":"multilink","cached_url":"find-your-nearest-group"},"background_color":"bg-white","black_background":false},{"_uid":"d99369f6-e543-4bb5-ae14-202f3c8b5c24","image":{"id":4707339,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/1600x1440/c2ea324923/invite-us-to-speak-800x720.jpg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"INVITE US TO SPEAK TO YOUR ORGANISATION. ","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"type":"hard_break","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"text":"WE WANT TO GET PEOPLE TALKING ABOUT MENTAL HEALTH.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"type":"hard_break","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"type":"hard_break","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"text":"DROP US AN ","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"text":"EMAIL","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"info@andysmanclub.co.uk","uuid":null,"anchor":null,"target":null,"linktype":"email"}},{"type":"bold"},{"type":"italic"},{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]},{"text":".","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"},{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]}]},"component":"offset-image-and-text","background_color":"bg-black"}],"meta":{"_uid":"d7b57ea5-11f6-4300-bc9c-fcc9052f7d5e","title":"Who We Are | Andy's Man Club","plugin":"seo_metatags","og_image":"","og_title":"","description":"We run talking groups for men who have either been through a storm, are currently going through a storm, have a storm brewing in life or just want to meet a good group of people with the aim of improving one another.","twitter_image":"","twitter_title":"","og_description":"","twitter_description":""},"component":"page"}

node.name: Andysmanclub is a very relaxed
node.content: {"_uid":"b0487ef1-029e-413d-b6bf-d29f89ea30e9","person":"","content":"ANDYSMANCLUB is a very relaxed atmosphere once you get settled. The hardest part is taking the first step through the door but ask any of the guys that have done it and they'll tell you they're glad they did.","component":"testimonial"}

node.name: I'm intensely passionate
node.content: {"_uid":"4fcc405f-141b-4b0e-95e4-02eb83e3bcc0","person":"Luke Ambler, Co-Founder & Chairman of Andy’s Man Club","content":"I'm intensely passionate about people, and more importantly, helping to empower them to be the best they can be. I love delivering workshops and talks to audiences of all ages.","component":"testimonial"}

node.name: Thanks-to-AMC
node.content: {"_uid":"501350ca-b8d8-4542-9209-14a10f48359a","person":"","content":"Thanks to AMC and the fantastic lads at Hemsworth I’m slowly getting back to being me. Getting back to being a better partner, a batter dad and a better friend. Thanks lads.","component":"testimonial"}

node.name: What-an-incredibe-legacy
node.content: {"_uid":"501350ca-b8d8-4542-9209-14a10f48359a","person":"","content":"What an incredible legacy has been built from a tragic loss of life. Went to my first meet last night, the peer support around the country this charity is offering is a phenomenon. So many lives changed and so many lives saved… the numbers will grow and grow. Andy will be looking down as proud as anything.","component":"testimonial"}

node.name: You-guys-have-helped-me
node.content: {"_uid":"501350ca-b8d8-4542-9209-14a10f48359a","person":"","content":"You guys have helped me come back from killing myself and being homeless to finding myself and now a little while on I have a home, a wife, a child, a dog and my whole life ahead of me. Can’t thank you enough!","component":"testimonial"}

node.name: thanks-andys-man-club
node.content: {"_uid":"501350ca-b8d8-4542-9209-14a10f48359a","person":"","content":"Thanks ANDYSMANCLUB, I went for the first time on Monday and I feel good. I should have done this a long time ago.","component":"testimonial"}

node.name: Two-years-ago
node.content: {"_uid":"501350ca-b8d8-4542-9209-14a10f48359a","person":"","content":"Two years ago today this club literally saved my life. I was very unwell and had decided this world would be better off without me.  How grateful I am that these guys wouldn’t let me go, they found me, they listened to me and they made me see I had people who cared. Through this group of amazing people I have never gone back to the depths I was in that day and I am proud to call them brothers #ITSOKAYTOTALK","component":"testimonial"}

node.name: Andysmanclub has been a huge potential
node.content: {"_uid":"501350ca-b8d8-4542-9209-14a10f48359a","person":"","content":"ANDYSMANCLUB has been a huge personal help to me and people I'm close to, and I want to give something back to them.","component":"testimonial"}

node.content: {"_uid":"c8c3fbd9-4892-457d-bf10-4f8d1b96aa31","body":[{"_uid":"7efe5cad-8559-49ba-b176-46765fdceec9","title":"It's okay to talk.","component":"hero","hero_image":{"id":4338884,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/900x800/5973181347/900x800.png","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"button_text":"Find your nearest group","description":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"ANDYSMANCLUB is a men’s mental health charity, offering free to attend peer-to-peer support groups for men across the UK. We support men with their mental health through conversation and positive action. #ITSOKAYTOTALK","type":"text"}]}]},"button_target":{"id":"2044bc06-79e9-45ee-b058-33589a20aae5","url":"","linktype":"story","fieldtype":"multilink","cached_url":"faqs-sections"},"background_color":"bg-white"},{"_uid":"b26b11d5-dbd7-4157-a7ac-fc6e1b7b1bd8","position":"right","component":"badge","background_color":"bg-black"},{"_uid":"c7e1f457-4a46-46a7-995f-5a8d7da128c0","label":"Who we are","title":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"We break down the stigma of men's mental health.","type":"text"}]}]},"content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"ANDYSMANCLUB is a male-only support group where men aged 18 and over can come and get things off their chest and speak openly about their mental health in a judgement-free, non-clinical environment. ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"We have almost ","type":"text"},{"text":"130 groups","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"/testimonial-sections","uuid":"f923d539-4e07-4dbc-a6b3-12e3a6e449aa","anchor":null,"target":null,"linktype":"story"}}]},{"text":" across the UK, where each group meets at the same time each week, ","type":"text"},{"text":"every Monday (except bank holidays) at 7pm.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"text":"  ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"With a service used on a weekly basis by ","type":"text"},{"text":"over 3000 men","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"https://www.google.co.uk/","uuid":null,"anchor":null,"target":null,"linktype":"url"}}]},{"text":" and an army of over 900 volunteers on board, the movement is continuing to grow on a week by week basis. It takes ","type":"text"},{"text":"true courage","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"test@test.com","uuid":null,"anchor":null,"target":null,"linktype":"email"}}]},{"text":" for a ","type":"text"},{"text":"man","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/800x800/9554bac8c2/800x800.png","uuid":null,"anchor":null,"target":null,"linktype":"asset"}}]},{"text":" to admit when he’s down but ","type":"text"},{"text":"#ITSOKAYTOTALK","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"text":".","type":"text"}]}]},"component":"two-column-text","button_text":"More about us","button_target":{"id":"f923d539-4e07-4dbc-a6b3-12e3a6e449aa","url":"","linktype":"story","fieldtype":"multilink","cached_url":"testimonial-sections"},"background_color":"bg-white","white_background":false},{"_uid":"13bb0473-9500-466f-8761-42e823936399","image":{"id":4396379,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/1000x750/b160a0bfdd/1000x750.png","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"label":"ANDY’S MAN CLUB","title":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"THE FIRST RULE ABOUT ANDYSMANCLUB IS ","type":"text"},{"text":"IT’S OKAY TO TALK","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"text":" AT ANDYSMANCLUB.","type":"text"}]}]},"content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Simply put, that’s the whole point. It’s a group where men don’t have to battle to be heard or listened to, but where they can join the fight against reducing the rate of mental illness, depression and suicide in men.","type":"text"}]}]},"component":"simple-center-branded-with-image","button_text":"Button here","button_target":{"id":"8e39701f-c3fd-4cab-aff1-d06075e84542","url":"","linktype":"story","fieldtype":"multilink","cached_url":"site-defaults"},"background_color":"bg-white"},{"_uid":"7c8d2869-962b-4285-900a-59de462c1361","image":{"id":4440460,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/500x700/318c361fba/500x700-1.png","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"},"label":"Our Why","title":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"WE HAVE ONE AIM, TO HELP ONE GUY, TO SAVE ONE LIFE.","type":"text"}]}]},"content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"ANDYSMANCLUB takes its name from Andrew Roberts, ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"a man who sadly took his own life aged 23 in early 2016. Andy was a lovely and doting father, son, brother, grandson, nephew, cousin and friend, and was just 23 years old when he was taken away by suicide, sadly and tragically without warning.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"On average one man every two hours takes his life in the UK. It’s often said to be a factor is that men don’t talk. That’s why ANDYSMANCLUB was born. Established in 2016 by Luke Ambler, Andy’s brother-in-law, the aim of the club is to break down these stigmas, support men struggling with mental health issues and lend a hand to suicide prevention. ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"That change starts with you...","type":"text"}]}]},"component":"two-column-text-image","button_text":"Donate node.name: ANDYSMANCLUB x Urban Network: Perry Ashby
node.content:
{"_uid":"42663d39-8b76-4c31-8b4d-c0dbd23621d0","body":[{"_uid":"31441e4e-18eb-494c-9014-68cd1e558934","title":"","content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"With the first ANDYSMANCLUB in London opening imminently, we sat down with Perry Ashby, the CEO of ","type":"text"},{"text":"Urban Network","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"https://www.urbannetwork.co.uk/","uuid":null,"anchor":null,"target":"_blank","linktype":"url"}}]},{"text":" – a company who have helped us make inroads into the capital – about the potential impact opening a group in London could have!","type":"text"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"How did you first hear of ANDYSMANCLUB and the work AMC is doing?","type":"text"},{"type":"hard_break"},{"type":"hard_break"},{"text":"
","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":" ","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":" ","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"
","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"
","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"

Subscribe

","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"
* indicates required
","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"
","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"
","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"
","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"
","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"
","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"
","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"
","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"
","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"
","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Urban Network’s first introduction to AMC was via one of their trustees, Leon McQuade, who is also a member of the Network Group, the UK’s leading technical community, where our CEO, Perry Ashby, holds the Chairman position.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"PA: “We were deeply concerned to learn that one in eight men in the UK suffers from a mental health problem and that three-quarters of all suicides in the UK were men. We knew we wanted to be part of ensuring the voice of AMC was heard in the south of the UK, and do our bit in supporting the charity to reduce these shocking statistics.”","type":"text"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"How much of a need do you think there is for a group like ANDYSMANCLUB in London?","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"PA: “London is such an amazing city. In our opinion, it’s the best city in the world! But it is also one of the most pressurised environments in which to work. Even the daily commute can take its toll and raise your stress levels.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"A safe and welcoming environment, like that which AMC offers, may make the difference between someone being able to talk about their problems, or family and friends only finding out about them when it’s too late. Suicide is the biggest killer of men under the age of 45 in the UK – AMC is working to counteract that, and we are fully behind them in this aim.”","type":"text"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"Have you experienced any stigma related to mental health?","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"PA: “Our industry is predominantly male and with this, there is always an element of bravado. People might say everything is great with them, but often it may not be so great. It can be hard to open up and say to someone that you are struggling to cope or are worried about a particular issue, for fear of what they may think. The more we talk about men’s mental health, the more normalised it will become and this will help to remove the stigma.”","type":"text"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"What led you to the decision to support AMC?","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"PA: “Urban Network is committed to making sure that there is someone, somewhere that is available to listen to you, should you ever need them. AMC fully fits that value and therefore we are very proud to help their message be heard.”","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Want to find out more about Urban Network? Head to their ","type":"text"},{"text":"website","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"https://www.urbannetwork.co.uk/","uuid":null,"anchor":null,"target":"_blank","linktype":"url"}}]},{"text":".","type":"text"}]}]},"component":"centered","background_color":"bg-white"},{"_uid":"fbdcf1a1-9384-4107-b6e0-ca6ae58056ef","items":["8eb38a6f-7a5c-43a8-b283-6a736e47e4e9","9bd1cc14-3c8d-4f68-8219-44d5e7ecda04","efa9dbfc-809f-4157-8172-fc262835b6be"],"component":"three-column-cards","custom_label":"","custom_title":"","background_color":"bg-white"}],"meta":{"_uid":"c96a5e49-43eb-4cae-921b-021f78eff6bf","title":"ANDYSMANCLUB x Urban Network: Perry Ashby | ANDYSMANCLUB","plugin":"meta-fields","description":"With the first ANDYSMANCLUB in London opening imminently, we sat down with Perry Ashby, the CEO of Urban Network – a company who have helped us make inroads into the capital – about the potential impact opening a group in London could have!"},"component":"news_views","description":"","featured_image":{"id":4953640,"alt":null,"name":"","focus":null,"title":null,"filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/1500x1000/00364cb510/amc-x-urban-networks-1500x1000.jpg","copyright":null,"fieldtype":"asset"}}

node.name: INTRODUCING… The Noisy Brain
node.content: {"_uid":"42663d39-8b76-4c31-8b4d-c0dbd23621d0","body":[{"_uid":"31441e4e-18eb-494c-9014-68cd1e558934","title":"","content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"At the start of the new year, we spoke to Stuart Mills, founder of The Noisy Brain, about his Mental Health journey and his project!","type":"text"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"Tell us a bit about yourself and the noisy brain project & what is the power behind using creativity as a tool of coping with Mental Health issues?","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Hello all! Thanks to AndysManClub for inviting me to tell my story and share a little about The Noisy Brain idea! ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"I’ve taken the liberty to combine the first two questions. It’ll start of a bit arty-farty but bear with it. It’ll get worse…","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"‘Kintsugi’ is the Japanese art of repairing broken pottery pieces with gold. The idea is to emphasise the breakage and repair rather than being something to be ashamed of, disguise or throw away. The repaired object now has a story to tell and therefore has experience, learnings and greater wisdom.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"The Japanese use this same analogy when appreciating the ability of an individual who has overcome traumatic events during their life.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"I now recognise that the meaning behind ‘Kintsugi’ is a great philosophy to reflect on when dealing with and living through life’s harder times. It has helped me realise that everything we go through shapes and strengthens us for our futures. And each of our endeavours in helping others become a little bit stronger with meaningful shared experiences and subsequent learnings.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"That is also why I admire everyone involved with AMC. Those who set it up and equally those who attend, share and help each other. As human beings, we each need this obvious and simple connection. ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"So, along with the Kintsugi mindset, talking things through is important. AMC’s #ITSOKAYTOTALK is something I have often fallen back on and advised friends, family and colleagues to do. We all need this simple human outlet of talking openly and honestly in this horrible world of anti-social media. ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"A little about me. I was born in the seaside town of Folkestone in Kent, England. I worked in the awful industry of advertising for almost 30 years, creating ideas for global brands at some of the world’s most famous agencies like Saatchi & Saatchi in London and Ogilvy & Mather in Singapore. My work took me around the world — from England to; Australia, Singapore, Vietnam, South Korea and currently I’m back and settled in Singapore.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"It was in Singapore around 2019 that I re-encountered my personal mental health demons. I suffered a lengthy period of depression, suicidal thoughts and ‘self medicating’ with prolonged bouts of alcohol abuse.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Intrusive suicidal thoughts became a huge part of my life. Moments of relaxation and fun suddenly became scarily frightening, leading to anxiety-fuelled moments of uncontrollable thoughts of various ways to potentially end it all.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Let me attempt to explain.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Enjoying a film at the cinema could be ruined by simply seeing a scene where a character innocently drove by a tall building or bridge. Nothing at all happened with those two reference points. They literally only needed to appear as a fleeting image for my mind to become trapped and transfixed on them.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"My mind wouldn’t allow me to continue watching the film. It would take me hostage on an anxiety-causing mental exploration of nearby places to end it all. I would be transported towards the nearest tall buildings and bridges, looking and studying the exact places I would land and where people might find me laying. All this while still sat eating popcorn with my wife in my comfy cinema seat.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"I’m fairly sure I was never actually going to go through with any of these intrusively scary scenarios. But, the fact I can’t even type that sentence and put a ‘definitely’ within it, makes for uncomfortable writing. Those intrusive thoughts that occupied my focus created some of the scariest, unnerving and, yes, I could even go as far as calling them terrifying moments of my life.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"I suppose when these intrusive thoughts happen, we need to understand that they’re only fleeting. We must try to recognise this, pause, and not react too quickly. We need to reach out to our trusted friends and family. Talk it through with them and then visit experts who are qualified to have these important chats. This can and should be done without shouldering any of the stigmas that society has allowed to accompany these situations.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"I struggle writing these pieces at the best of times with my habit of overthinking everything. I’ve often thought that this is half the problem. If we were able to control the overthinking in our noisy brains, would we sail through life? Now there’s something else we can all start overthinking!","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"All this had a domino effect which culminated in a situation that I could have easily avoided if only I had opened up and talked with someone. But, as most of us know, that’s not easy to do until it is often too late. I’d spiralled into a mindset where everything and everybody else was the problem and drinking to forget had become the norm.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"I was caught on video in an unnecessarily aggressive altercation with a local after being out drinking for a few days. Widespread outrage and a social media storm followed, including death threats to myself and my family. This forced me into a self-inflicted lockdown. The next 6 months were some of the darkest, but this was also when a transformation started to take place. I was again diagnosed with a major depressive disorder, underwent therapy, found out that I’d almost definitely had ADHD all my life, had further counselling, and ended up serving a short sentence in Singapore’s notorious Changi prison.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Keeping ‘kintsugi’ in mind, my continued recovery gives me the strength to acknowledge the harm I have done to others and myself. In the long run, it’s those flaws that make me who I am and now give me the strength, energy and positivity to pick up the pieces, rejoin them and make myself stronger than ever.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"And while things may never be how they were, I’ve finally found a purpose in establishing The Noisy Brain to raise awareness and help others with their Mental and Emotional Health Issues (MEHI).","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Through my contributions, I hope to help others embrace their imperfections as something to be worked with, not shamed and hidden. ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"I have now decided I want to encourage people to embrace their problems, share them and turn them into positives. Maybe we can each help others discover their own journey of ‘kintsugi’ and take steps towards their own unexpected strengths.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"Can you give us an overview of the community that use the Noisy Brain’s App and the wide range of content that is posted?","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"So, in brief… ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"The Noisy Brain is a steadily growing global community collaboration of people with Mental or Emotional Health Issues, musicians/recording artists, writers, and fantastic supporters, all helping each other break the stigma surrounding Mental Health.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"We encourage anyone dealing with their Mental or Emotional Health Issues to use writing as an outlet for sharing experiences. Writing is a great way of opening up. Sharing allows others to feel less alone and vulnerable.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Each shared ‘writing’ inspires others to contribute. It encourages more open and relatable conversations about the issues people are dealing with, leading to greater awareness. ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"The Noisy Brain takes these words that can harm us when kept inside and turns them into songs to inspire others. Songs are made with the amazing talents of collaborative musicians from all around the world.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"THE NOISY BRAIN","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Creating a more forgiving world,","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"One Lyric & One Song at a time.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"We gladly receive writings from anyone dealing with Mental and Emotional Health Issues. You don’t need to be a poet or musician. I’m certainly not! Just getting the words out of your head can help to release negative emotions. The benefits of opening up about your personal anxieties to others and writing about it are massive:","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"It gives it a face.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"It gives it a voice.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"It gives you perspective.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"It allows others to connect.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Let’s face it. We all need to connect and communicate more. A little less time on (anti) social media and more time making meaningful connections. Sharing stories from your mental and emotional struggles allows others to feel less alone and isolated.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"The Noisy Brain would love to invite you to join us as a contributor.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Contact us on: stu@thenoisybrain.com","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"or click on the link on our Instagram bio to get started! @thenoisybrainer","type":"text"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"How have music and the creative arts helped you deal with your own Mental Health?","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"First things first – I have zero musical ability. This is a big part of the reason why I created The Noisy Brain. ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Immediately after my incident, I had this uncontrollable urge to write. I literally couldn’t stop. At the time, my mind was very disturbed with suicidal thinking, depression and self-medication. But there was also a creative outpouring of varied emotions that I had completely bottled up inside. This was only released once I opened up and talked. Admitting to my wife, family and friends that I had problems with depression and suicide was the first step towards an amazing and liberating experience. If only I had the guts to talk to my loved ones before things took a turn for the worse, I could have avoided hurting others and myself along the way.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"As all of you that attend ANDYSMANCLUB already know; talking literally allows everything to flow. The release is immense. For me and others like me, talking opens that pressure valve – #ITSOKAYTOTALK","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Don’t get me wrong. A majority of what I was writing was (and still is) shit! But I’m at least getting it all out of my head and out of me. The act of writing in isolation created other frustrations. I wasn’t sharing these anxiety-fuelled written rants. I was only reading my anxiety and problems back to myself. ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"It was only when I shared my written rants with someone that I realised the full benefits. That amazing person put one of my rants to music.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"The Noisy Brain is an idea focused on mental health, music and wellness. The platform (app, web, social) has been created to help encourage people with mental and emotional health issues to write and openly share their writings in a safe space. We celebrate and embrace these ‘Noisy Brains’, encouraging them into musical collaborations with an aim to create beautiful pieces of music. This simple but important process has the potential to provide a therapeutic creative outlet. Ultimately, we hope to; Create a more forgiving world, one lyric, and one song at a time.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"The effects of music are amazing. It helps relieve anxiety and stress, calms breathing, improves mood and helps people with their overall well-being. When collaborating on The Noisy Brain, musicians have the opportunity to uplift our contributors by adopting submitted ‘writings’ and putting the lyrics to music.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Musicians and recording artist from all over the world, read through our bank of writings and the short background story that inspired each piece. Artists often collaborate directly with the writer to help improve the finished song or demo. We then ask that the musicians credit the contributors as co-writers on their finished songs. Writers then also have the potential of earning royalties if their song is released.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"How can people access the app and how can they best use it?","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Please Download and share The Noisy Brain FREE app, please spread the word within your own community. There’s still a long way to go and happy to hear any suggestions and receive any writings from you.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Here’s a quick download link:","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"https://noisybrain.disciplemedia.com/signup/nYZD6Y","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"https://noisybrain.disciplemedia.com/signup/nYZD6Y","uuid":null,"anchor":null,"target":"_blank","linktype":"url"}}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"We completely understand that sharing is not for everybody. But in the spirit of openness that The Noisy Brain embraces, we believe that the more people who are willing to talk openly, the more likely it is that others will relate, feel less alone and share their own stories without the fear of stigma.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"This is the open movement we are creating. Let’s start conversations, let’s start removing the stigma surrounding Mental and Emotional Health Issues.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Sharing our own stories is necessary to help others. We are all fighting battles that nobody knows about. Being open and honest encourages others to do likewise and in turn it helps change perceptions. So, let’s get talking, let’s start listening and let’s start sharing.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"#ITSOKAYTOTALK","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"The Noisy Brain wants to invite you to join their growing community as a contributor. ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Please contact me directly on:","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"stu@thenoisybrain.com","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"stu@thenoisybrain.com","uuid":null,"anchor":null,"target":"_blank","linktype":"email"}}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"or","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"hello@thenoisybrain.com","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"hello@thenoisybrain.com","uuid":null,"anchor":null,"target":"_blank","linktype":"email"}}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"or ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"On the link on our Instagram bio to get started! @thenoisybrainer","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"We would love to see you download our app and join the mutual collaborative efforts of sharing truths and helping each other that both AndysManClub and The Noisy Brain both strive for and both support. ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"We look forward to seeing you become part of the growing community and see you sharing your ‘writings’ and experiences on The Noisy Brain app very soon. ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Thanks for all your continued support to everyone at AndysManClub. ","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Good luck with everything you are each pursuing this year and remember #ITSOKAYTOTALK","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Stu","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"The Noisy Brain","type":"text"}]}]},"component":"centered","background_color":"bg-white"},{"_uid":"fbdcf1a1-9384-4107-b6e0-ca6ae58056ef","items":["efa9dbfc-809f-4157-8172-fc262835b6be","9bd1cc14-3c8d-4f68-8219-44d5e7ecda04","e9512c4f-078a-4425-a019-dc47dd81ed8c"],"component":"three-column-cards","custom_label":"","custom_title":"","background_color":"bg-white"}],"meta":{"_uid":"c96a5e49-43eb-4cae-921b-021f78eff6bf","title":"Introducing... The Noisy Brain | ANDYSMANCLUB","plugin":"meta-fields","description":"At the start of the new year, we spoke to Stuart Mills, founder of The Noisy Brain, about his Mental Health journey and his project! Read more..."},"component":"news_views","description":"","featured_image":{"id":4953649,"alt":null,"name":"","focus":null,"title":null,"filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/1500x1000/52753cb880/introducing-the-noisy-brain-1500x1000.jpg","copyright":null,"fieldtype":"asset"}}

node.name: Around the venues: Paul Carver - Dancestars Bradford
node.content: {"_uid":"4b33c7a1-d80b-4974-954a-bc00187a77e1","body":[{"_uid":"38804567-ec6a-48b8-9555-2aedce496910","title":"","content":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"This week, we sat down for a chat with Paul Carver, owner of Dancestars Bradford our venue in the city for almost 12 months! We were in Bradford for a media interview featuring one of our facilitators in the city, Kapil Patel.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"},{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"How did you first get involved with ANDYSMANCLUB?","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"My first involvement with ANDYSMANCLUB was offering our venue, Dancestars dance studio, as a location for Andys Man Club Bradford to host its face-to-face sessions. I’ve always had an interest in doing something to support mental health as my Granddad took his own life without warning when I was 13. This had a profound effect on me personally so when I saw on Facebook that ANDYSMANCLUB needed a venue, I looked across at my missus and said, we’ve got a venue, let’s do it! During the pandemic, there was a lot of disruption to everyone’s schedule and to be able to help provide the men of Bradford with a place they could get things off their chest was a no-brainer.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"Give us some background on your business and your venue.","type":"text"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Dancestars as a business started 17 years ago in BD6 operating out of a community centre, and in 2017 we moved to our second permanent venue on Sunbridge Road and we’re continuing to go from strength to strength. We’ve got two massive main dance studios which are used most nights of the week for dance classes and a big reception area – we’re happy to keep it all free on a Monday night for AMC.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"What is it like hosting AMC on a Monday night? Are there any challenges?","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"It is honestly plain-sailing! It works seamlessly, the facilitators are great and on the rare occasion that I’m not here on a Monday night, the team are in regular contact with me, have their own key and I trust them to open up and lock up the venue themselves. They are never a problem and there is a complete level of trust between us. It feels great for us to be able to give something to such a worthy, needed and necessary cause.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"Have you used the session yourself?","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Absolutely! I didn’t know or think I was going to but after sitting in one session, I’ve made sure I’m at the sessions every Monday now – I even move other things in my diary so I can attend every week.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"What would you say to anyone debating coming to a group?","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Do it – it’s easier said than done, it can be the most daunting thing in the world – walking up to a group of guys that you don’t know, not knowing what you are going to be walking into. That first step across the threshold could change your life – it’s really empowering and even if you don’t say anything on your first session, just sitting there, having a brew, listening to other blokes and being a part of it can really release some shackles off of you to start talking yourself.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"text":"What would your advice be to anyone who could potentially offer AMC a venue?","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"Again – do it! If you’ve got a venue and you have the scope and availability to do it and open on a Monday night then do it. It is a really empowering feeling knowing that you’re doing something to help a charity, and it’s not just any charity. We can all put a quid in a charity pot at a shop but you don’t actually always see the direct result of that. If you are in a position where you can offer a venue to a group of blokes, be it six blokes or fifty blokes that turn up on a Monday – you are saving lives, you’re giving them somewhere to go, somewhere to talk and it is one of the best things I’ve ever done – if there was a cost to us as a business, we’d still do it without a shadow of a doubt.","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"styled","attrs":{"class":""}}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"text":"You can find out more about our venue in Bradford by clicking ","type":"text"},{"text":"here","type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"https://www.bradford-dance.co.uk/","uuid":null,"anchor":null,"target":"_blank","linktype":"url"}}]},{"text":"!","type":"text"}]}]},"component":"centered","background_color":"bg-white"},{"_uid":"5d49be26-d33c-4793-b079-81260bc33916","items":["8eb38a6f-7a5c-43a8-b283-6a736e47e4e9","259dd1d5-d3e8-46fe-8936-622dd318b408","eb5b3dfe-3d35-4df2-b860-01af0170a9df"],"component":"three-column-cards","custom_label":"","custom_title":"","background_color":"bg-white"}],"meta":{"_uid":"7cb37fd6-b557-42a6-af46-ca7c6e324537","title":"AROUND THE VENUES: Paul Carver – Dancestars Bradford | ANDYSMANCLUB","plugin":"meta-fields","description":"This week, we sat down for a chat with Paul Carver, owner of Dancestars Bradford our venue in the city for almost 12 months! We were in Bradford for a media interview featuring one of our facilitators in the city, Kapil Patel."},"component":"news_views","description":"","featured_image":{"id":4964118,"alt":"","name":"","focus":null,"title":"","filename":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/153326/1500x1000/17fe2ff976/around-the-venues-dancestars-bradford-1500x1000.jpg","copyright":"","fieldtype":"asset"}}
